this proven approach this worked hundreds and hundreds of times we're gonna share that with you today and
there's three main phases there's an assessment phase let's understand what
we have today where we are what our readiness capabilities are where we need
to invest let's do a business case let's discover what we really have and have a
very accurate view of what we think the returns might be and let's size this thing up let's assess where we are so we
could size it up and get ready to put a detailed plan in place and then that next phase is readiness in planning
that's where we actually do the heavy lifting the engineering work the application portfolio analysis the
operating model building the actual migration plan creating groups of
applications move groups in what order based on a business requirement so that's where the heavy lifting gets done
and then the actual migration itself is a third phase that's where we actually move things at scale into AWS and then
once they're there we operate that so we break it down into simplified phases we
have sets of activities and outcomes associated with each of those phases so if we start in the assessment phase one
of the things that we do here is a migration readiness assessment workshop
we call it MRA for short and some of you may have heard of the calf cloud
adoption framework model that we have at AWS it looks at six different dimensions
three of the dimensions are on the business capability side the other three are in
technical capability side and on the business capability side we look at the
business how already is the business to realize the outcomes that we're trying to achieve at the board level and what
are the business objectives it always starts with the customer the business objectives and we work back from the
customers business objectives and then we look at people we look at the roles that are in place the readiness even the
cultural aspects in how the place is organized in the technology side and the
business side and we look at the governance the readiness to govern not what's there today but in a cloud world
and on the tech side we look at platform readiness both apps and infrastructure
security and operations and we have a list it's a questionnaire of 69
questions and we get in the room we do this very quickly it's often a four to six hour thing and what's beautiful
about this is we get people in a room that we're never in a room together before both at AWS and at a customer
business leaders come with technology leaders come with finance people come CISOs come whoever we can get who we
believe are the right stakeholders with the customer at that point and we debate for four to six hours so it's not AWS
filling out a scorecard it is red yellow green across each of these dimensions these are these questions we debate with
the customer and we use our experiences from hundreds of migrations to say you know here's how we would answer that
based on this other pattern that we've seen or experience and we come up with a heat map and it's a board level report
that we put out within a week of doing the workshop and this has become the best practice because it informs the
areas that needed to be invested in from a readiness standpoint to be successful in achieving those business outcomes the
second thing we do in the assessment phase is we apply tooling and tooling
that helps us understand the current environment in great detail so we're super excited I think TSO is in the room today they're
now in the AWS family so adias acquired TSO & TSO has a number of tools but the
one we use the most here as a data collector tool it's an agentless tool so you might say
hey that's gonna be tough we can't get it through sec our kits gonna delay things by eight weeks that's true with
some other tools but this one is agent lists we put it in one VM it studies the environment we like to run it anywhere
from ten to thirty days so we get a real good snapshot and it looks at all of the
servers and it also looks at CPU what is the real utilization what are the peaks
or the averages it looks at disk and it looks at memory and part of the way
we're able to get these 30 to 50 percent savings is we write size we look for
waste in the existing environment where we've done too much CPU or maybe we put
more remember you than we need maybe we put 4 gigs when we needed to so we can
study that and understand that and then have an optimized architectural recommendation right from the tool so tool do this curry
data comes in through the collector the second part of this tool is the analysis tool if you happen for some reason not
to be able to run the collector we can feed in your own data sets and CMDB and do that same kind of analysis but we
prefer to get the real-time snapshot and do that analysis TSO has also done a
study across 200,000 OS instances and 20
enterprises in the average savings out of the box in that study was 36% just
using one technique right sizing and there's many other optimizations that we
could do on the architecture side there's optimizations we could do on the financial instrument size with spot
pricing with reserved instances and this is how you see people get a multiple on the additional savings that they can get
the TSO tool also helps you optimize your microsoft and sequel server licensing and make recommendations on
how you could save money there so very important tool that we bring in and once
we have that data and we've done the MRA assessment we begin to build the
